text:
I'm having problems with 

 apache -k stop 

on IBM laptop with windows98 (I know, its experimental - setting low severity)

History
 - Installed using .msi
 - apache -k uninstall (I never liked the 'service' for win98)
 - apache -k start doesn't work - no such service
 - apache -k install 

Monitor stops working at this point

 - apache -k stop is 'sluggish', not properly responding. 
Service is not properly responding, and trying to kill the service is the worst,
always leaves the socket open. 

Proposed resolution:
 - Don't install as 'service' on win98, there is no such real thing and has been  
   flagged many times as 'not supported/experimental' - so let it be so!
creator: gunnar.ahlberg@home.se

text:
Related to this, if running 2.0.x on Win2k as a console app and NOT as a 
service, the "-k restart" and "-k shutdown" arguments do not function. Both 
return the following error:

[Thu Jul 04 00:38:16 2002] [error] (22502)The system cannot find the file 
specified.  : No installed service named "Apache2".
I believe -k arguments no longer assume a service.
